column2: NEW MEXICO PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: New Mexico

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Many crashes are caused by:
column4: driving too fast for conditions.
column6: frequently checking mirrors and blind spot.
column8: yielding the right of way.
column10: maintaining a 4-second following distance between your vehicle and any vehicle in front of you.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column6: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column8: Shopping centre ahead.
column10: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.

column2: 3. If you become sleepy while driving you should:
column4: drink coffee.
column8: get some rest or change drivers.

column2: 4. When being passed by another vehicle, drivers should:
column4: slow down.
column8: maintain a constant speed.

column2: 5. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column6: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column8: call the fire department immediately.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column6: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column8: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.

column2: 7. Although there may be enough room in the traffic lane for an automobile and a motorcyclist, a vehicle driver should not share the lane with motorcyclists.
column4: True

column2: 8. The sign in the picture:
column4: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column6: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column8: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column10: means that you need to stop.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: No U-turns
column8: All traffic must turn right at next intersection
column10: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 10. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: Flashing red light
column8: Stop sign

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: No U-turns
column8: No right turn

column2: 12. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you, you must:
column4: drive to the right edge of the road and slow down.
column8: pull over to the right and stop.
column10: stop as quickly as you can.

column2: 13. If two vehicles arrive at a four-way stop at the same time:
column4: the vehicle on the right must yield to the vehicle on the left.
column6: the vehicle on the left must yield to the vehicle on the right.
column8: the driver on the left must signal the driver on the right to go.

column2: 14. If your vehicle has a mechanical problem, you should:
column4: stop in your lane and put on your emergency flashers.
column6: signal and pull into the slow lane.
column8: turn on your hazard lights and pull off the road.

column2: 15. When you drive into the street from any driveway you:
column4: must honk the horn so approaching vehicles and pedestrians can allow you room.
column6: must drive slowly so approaching vehicles and pedestrians can get out of your way.
column8: can disregard pedestrians if there is no sidewalk.
column10: must stop and proceed only when there are no pedestrians or vehicles approaching.

column2: 16. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.
column8: stop if necessary.

column2: 17. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column6: only if you have an emergency.
column8: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column10: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.

column2: 18. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column8: Brake early and gently.

column2: 19. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column4: Yield.
column8: Slow down.

column2: 20. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column6: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column8: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column10: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.

column2: 21. When you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light, you must:
column4: slow and proceed with caution.
column8: come to a complete stop, then proceed.

column2: 22. When changing lanes, you should not:
column4: check your side and rear view mirrors.
column8: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots
column10: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Warning, curves ahead
column6: Do not use your brakes in this area
column8: Warning, intersection ahead

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn permitted
column8: No right turn

column2: 25. BAC is:
column4: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column10: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
